intro: Azalea nipponica, commonly known as the Japanese azalea, is a species native to East Asia, particularly Japan. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters. The plant produces clusters of showy, funnel-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white during the spring. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and dark green, providing a striking contrast to the vibrant blooms. Azalea nipponica thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
